DOC.brief_summary: This is a 2-group study comparing the effect of a "prehabilitation" program to usual care on quality of life and clinical outcomes in patients undergoing elective repair of their thoracic aorta.
DOC.detailed_description: Patients undergoing elective repair of their thoracic aortic aneurysm will be randomized to a "prehabilitation" program prior to their surgery or to usual care. The prehabilitation program is self-directed program designed to improve health and quality of life prior to surgery. The program is currently offered to general surgery patients; this study will examine the feasibility and acceptability of such a program in a different patient population.
DOC.criteria: Age 21 years or older Diagnosis of thoracic aortic disease with scheduled repair Medical clearance from cardiothoracic surgeon Ability to provide informed consent Regular use of a smartphone or personal computer Conditions that limit walking to a severe degree Current participation in regular physical activity program Acute aortic dissection Recent coronary artery disease events Inability to speak and read English
